title: For Sale/Trade:  AK-74 Custom Rifle w/1080rds
postcontent:
For sale is a fully US compliant Bulgarian AK-74 semi-auto rifle.

I spent a lot of time & money in to fixing it up and refinishing the stock, but I need to sell the thing. I added a bolt hold open (for going ranges that don't allow rifles without them) and I did a lot of work polishing up the bolt to make it prettier, as-well as refinishing a wooden stock, staining it, and recessing a vintage Soviet pin in to the butt stock. 

Gets anywhere from 1-3 MOA at 50-75 yards depending on how you shoot.
Flawless accuracy if you use necked down .222 remington brass & .224 70gr resized to .221.

It comes with 3 thirty round magazines (I have 2 more, but I'm still in the process of refinishing them, you can have them if you want), an unopened case of 1080rds rounds (Bulgarian/Russian 1976? 7N6 53gr), extra black synthetic stock set, unissued East German cleaning kit, eastern bloc AK-74 muzzle brake.



I also have a new extra hunting thumbhole buttstock (wood), and a few different shaded foreign pistol grips for additional customizing.



Text, call, or email for more infor + pictures
(two zero five nine one nine three four four three)

Price is flexible, worst I can say is no to an offer

(First image is from when I was still working on it, notice the bolt hold open isn't there)

title: For Sale:  Custom S&W M&P Grip Work
postcontent:
Love the M&P pistol?  Wish the grip had more texture?  Tired of stick on grip tape and rubber sleeves that will only end up failing? Not interested in changing the entire appearance of the weapon?  If so, here is your answer.

Using the factory back strap of your choice (S,M,L) I will add a textured "scale-like" pattern to it which will add the extra grip shooters need to help manage recoil.  

I will also add a textured pattern to the front strap of the weapon which provides a course grip giving the shooter more control of the weapon.  

I will also add texture to the magazine release.

You can have one or all of the features done, pricing as follows:



Back Strap Only, Any Size                                         >  $75.00

Front Strap Only, Full Size                                         >  $65.00
Front Strap Only, Compact                                        >  $55.00

Magazine Release                                                     >  $10.00

Front & Back & Mag, Full Size                                     >  $140.00
Front & Back & Mag, Compact                                    >  $130.00

My work is currently being used by competitive shooters, instructors, law enforcement officers and tactical team members throughout Ohio.

postcontent: Remington Model 1889, Grade 1, side by side 12 gauge shotgun with decarbonized 30 inch Damascus steel barrels, double hammers and triggers, automatic ejector, and matted barrel rib.  The serial number, 64***, places its date of manufacture between 1889 and 1900, and it is a numbers-matching piece. title: For Sale:  Sig P220 .45 ACP with holster, extra magazines
postcontent:
Includes:

- handgun
- original factory hard case, with pre-cut foam insert
- two 7-round magazines, blue, that come with the gun
- four additional 8-round factory magazines, stainless  (currently $34 each at - CDNN Investments, or $136 for four).
- Galco MOB248 holster  ( $60 - $70 value).  Scroll down for pictures.








I bought this used back in December 2000, and haven't shot it since 2002 or 2003. 

It has Trijicon night sites, which are still glowing well enough to use, even though they're 10+ years old.

The case is marked 
220-45-K
P220-45 K, 2MAGS-7RD
I believe the "K" refers to Sig's K-Kote finish, although I'm not sure.

The finish shows some holster wear toward the muzzle end, but is in otherwise very good condition.

There is a piece of skateboard tape on the front grip. It was this way when I bought it.

The right side of the slide is marked "P220. Made in Germany" (not "W. Germany"), and the left side is marked "Sig Sauer. Sigarms Inc.. Exeter-NH"

There is no date or proof code. According to this internet forum thread, "If your German made slide doesn't have the proof marks and date code that means that the gun was never assembled in Germany. It was imported to Exeter to be assembled at SIGARMS. All handguns that are made in Germany must be proofed and stamped. Your SIG's were proofed in the US. You can probably find a circle P stamped on your barrel. That is the US proof." There is no circle P stamp on the barrel of this gun. I think they started doing that in 1995, so this gun would have been made between 1995 - 2000.

It has the American-style magazine release behind the trigger guard, not the European-style heel release.

For people who have asked, I am not willing to sell the guns without the extra magazines. The reason is simply that it would not be worth my time and effort to try to sell the magazines separately once the gun is sold. Now if somebody wants to buy the set of all four magazines separately for $140 before I sell the gun, then obviously I would lower the price of the gun. And no, I won't break up the set of magazines, again because it's not worth my time and effort to sell just one magazine. As noted above, they are available from CDNN. Besides, any serious handgunner should have as many magazines as possible, with 5 being a commonly recommended minimum. The reason for this is (1) be ready for any "serious social purpose," and (2) so you can use your range/training time more efficiently by shooting, instead of reloading magazines (you do load your magazines before going to the range, right?) Remember that magazines are the weak-link in semi-auto firearms: they are the part most likely to get dropped, broken, bent, stepped on, etc. The more you have, the better.



Robert DeNiro with SIG P220 in Heat (1995)


Steven Seagal with SIG P220 in Above the Law (1988)


Don Johnson with Colt 654 and SIG P220 in Miami Vice (1984)

FYI:  SIG does offer a .22 LR conversion kit for the P220.

title: For Sale:  Colt Python Hunter w/Leupold Scope Haliburton Case
postcontent:
Colt Python Hunter model with the 8 inch barrel, factory installed Colt-marked Leupold scope on Redfield mounts and packaged in the Haliburton case.  It includes the blue ammo box, cleaning rod, jag, brush, allen wrenches, manual, and warning tag with the yellow string.

The Colt Python Hunter was made only in 1980 and was the first field-ready handgun hunting package from a major handgun manufacturer.  Perhaps 2400 were produced.

Bench resting, on a sandbag, I have shot three inch groups of six rounds, using good ammunition and shooting very carefully.  Very very carefully.

This weapon has never been fired in anger, or in haste.  It has only been fired with care, and with love and with deep satisfaction.  Some will say that this is the BMW of the weapons from Colt.  Not true.  It is the Rolls Royce.  This is the finest revolver Colt ever produced.

This weapon is near to mint.  It has been shot, but it was perfectly maintained and is ready to become a part of the discriminating buyer’s collection.  This is a particularly fine weapon.  It’s the type of quality weapon that Thomas Crown would have and enjoy as part of his good life.  It’s one that the older Bond would appreciate and the newest Bond would kill for.  Oops.  Bad pun there.

This weapon is from my personal collection so there is no paperwork or sales tax.  It is an attempt to “thin out” what I own.  And perhaps to raise a little money for to spend.  Kind offers entertained and reasonable offers may be accepted.  

But, you must have a valid Arizona ID and be legally able and eligible to purchase one.  It is not suitable for mailing because of the extra fees involved, and because I want to sell only face to face and only here in Northwest Tucson or within some reasonable driving distance.

Cash (no checks, money orders, or stamps) is preferred, but interesting trades will be considered. I am seeking a short barreled 22 similar to the S&W model 36.  And who knows what else.  Please no leather, whips, chains, or teenage children.  Already have enough of those.  

Not incidentally, this weapon will never be listed on Ebay.  Or Craigslist.  Or be available at any of the Gun Shows because I don’t like the heat and dust and humility at the Pima County Fairgrounds.

title: For Sale:  Mosin/Nagant loaded with accessories
location: Southwest of Dallas in Stephenville, Dallas, Texas
postcontent: I have a Mosin/Nagant 91/30 with the round reciever made during the early years of WWII. Smooth operation with little to no marks or rust. Absolutely beautiful threads and shoots tight groups even with cheap surplus ammunition. Comes with bayonette, sling, cleaning kit, ammunition pouches, and 40 rounds of 182g. FMJ. In case you are unfamiliar with the round, the 7.62x54r is basically a .30 cal. Russian round with casing size in between a .308 and 30-06. With the power closer to the 30-06 and ballistics more similar to the .308. In other words, an incredibly versatile, accurate, and powerful round. Very capable of taking nearly if not all North American game with ease. Also i can give it a Duracoat job for another $100. Duracoat advertises and guarantees that it never wears. Only if you subject it to extreme shock and/or abrasives will it show wear. I would suggest tactical grey/green as it compliments the character of the rifle and is versatile in most environments.

title: For Sale:  WWII British Enfield No. 4 Mk. 1 .303 Rifle 1943
postcontent: Up for sale is an original WWII 1943 dated Enfield No. 4 Mk. 1.  This was the standard issue rifle to British soldiers in WWII and is the same type of rifle used by them on D-Day.  .303 cal.  Ammunition is easy to find and cheap.  This rifle still has some of its long term storage cosmoline on it so that it wouldn't rust.  Original finish.  No rust that I can see.  Stock is in very good condition.  Original stacking attachment is still on this rifle toward the muzzle.  Hard to find in this nice of condition.

title: For Sale:  **REDUCED PRICE** WWII Nazi Marked German K98 Rifle 8mm
postcontent: This is an original WWII Nazi Marked German K98 rifle in 8mm.  The ammo is cheap to find for this rifle and this is a true piece of history.  This is NOT A RUSSIAN capture K98.  Thus, it has not been refinished like all of the Russian capture ones.  This rifle has the original finish which is pretty worn.  Bore shows rifling.  ALL NAZI markings including eagles, swastikas, and inspector marks are PRESENT and are not peened (stamped out).  This is the real deal from WWII in original condition and setup.  The non-Russian capture original K98s with Nazi markings are getting hard to find these days.  There are some small spots of rust on the rifle but it should clean up nice.  The rifle was manufactured by "duv 1941" which was located in Berlin during WWII.

From MEC site: 

The MEC 650N gives maximum performance with a minimum of effort. It works on six shells at once. With every stroke, a reloaded shell is completed. The MEC 650N does not resize except as a separate operation. This is the ideal press for the person who wishes to resize and inspect their shells as a separate operation. The MEC SuperSizer is recommended to fill your resizing needs. 

The MEC 650N has three crimping stations. The first station starts the crimp. The second closes the crimp. And the third station places the taper on the shell that is so important for proper feeding in a pump or automatic.

Available in 12, 16, 20, 28 gauge, and .410 bore. Die sets are not available.

Minimum effort 
The Automatic Primer feed is standard. Fill with a full box of primers and the MEC 650N does the rest.

title: For Sale:  Rail upgrade with laser for 1911 style pistols
postcontent:
This adapter will upgrade your 1911 style pistol to use rail mount accessories.  I am including a red dot laser since that is normally why you would want a rail on your 1911.

The Israeli made adapter clamps onto the trigger guard and cradles around the frame.  I show it mounted on a Colt commander and you can see that it does not extend beyond the barrel. This is a Picatinny rail and will also accept any Weaver style rail accessories.  The laser is fully adjustable for elevation and windage.

This whole setup looks like new.

Asking $65 for the complete set, cash only.

title: For Sale:  Auto Ordinance 1911 Functions Flawlessly
location: West of Cleveland (Avon, Elyria area), Cleveland, Ohio
postcontent:
Every Red blooded American (or in this case, Ohio resident, non-felon with a driver's licence), should have a 1911.  Now is your chance to get one at a very fair price.  (No, I'm not a firearms dealer.)

I'm selling this Auto Ordinance 1911.  It functions flawlessly (never a failure to feed or eject since I've owned it).  

So why so cheap?  The frame had some pits, that I filled in with Duracoat leveler, then I duracoated the entire firearm.  (Look up Lauer Duracoat if you don't know what the finish is.) I did not fill in the pit near the serial #, as I didn't want to get anywhere near it.  Also... I didn't take the advice of the gunsmith who put on the duracoat, and fired it before full cure (2 weeks), and some of the durracoat rubbed off on the hammer (see photo)... it is purely cosmetic though.

The price I'm asking reflects these very minor cosmetic defects.  You'll see from the photos that I'm trying my best to disclose these slight defects.

Why am I selling?  Because I finally bought myself a 1911 Kimber, and think this will just sit in my safe until I die.  (And I'm planning a trip to Vegas :)

This gun comes with 2 magazines, and plastic pistol box.

Please no lowball offers... I'm not going to sell you this for $150 because you are the first to respond, and as you shop around, you'll see the price is fair.

I'm also interested in fair trades.  Email me some proposals, and I'll get back to you (usually the same day)

-Joe

title: For Sale:  Remington M700 200 year commemorative, NIB, Spectacular Maple Stock, limited edition.
postcontent:
Remington Model 700 BDL 200 year Anniversary 30-06, Absolutely Spectacularly figured Maple Stock, NIB! 

This rifle is NEW IN BOX and comes in the original factory box with the serialized, owners manual packet.  

This is the very desirable, nearly impossible to find new, very limited edition Remington Model 700 200 year anniversary of Eliphalet Remington in 30-06 with a 22" barrel made in 1993 and carefully vault stored ever since. The to celebrate the 200th Anniversary, Remington pulled out all the stops and fitted a collectors grade stock on this rifle in truly spectacular, ultra highly figured fiddleback maple finished in unstained natural maple high gloss finish with a Monte Carlo comb with raised cheekpiece, generous skip line cut checkering both on the pistol grip and for end, black caps on the for end, pistol grip and on the butt stock which wears the Remington logo. 

The pictures simply can't show the true beauty of the wood. The stock has a 3D, holographic effect to the exquisite fiddleback grain as you look at it from different angles. The rifle is factory drilled for scope mounts (I did install a weaver type mount off of another M700 BDL but never installed a scope) and is furnished with the factory sling swivel studs. Being a Model 700 BDL it has the factory Remington open sights installed with the front having a removable hood and the rear being adjustable for windage and elevation. The magazine has a hinged floor plate that has a gold filled etching paying homage the 200th anniversary of the company's founder and the metal work has a rich, deep blue gloss finish which looks superb with the gorgeous maple stock. Also, note that this rifle does NOT have the silly locking bolt shroud as some later 700's do. As you would expect on a NIB rifle there is no wear on the bolt face.

 The rifle is listed elsewhere at a fixed price.

Shipping is $40.00 to your FFL to the lower 47 (Sorry, I DO NOT ship to California) states. Ak and Hi will be higher and I will only ship to the 49 US states, no exceptions what so ever. I am an individual, not a dealer so be sure your FFL accepts shipments from individuals. If your ffl requires shipments from another FFL holder that will cost extra and contact me first to find out how much extra. I highly recommend insurance (additional approximately $.75 per thousand of value) for this item. The rifle will be very securely packaged.

You are responsible for checking as to whether this gun is legal in your state or locality! I will ship ONLY to your FFL and require a signed in ink copy of your receiving FFL's holders license. No exceptions. 

I am open to the possibility of a face to face sale to a bonafide Arkansas resident to save you on shipping. I also believe in describing an item accurately, pretty easy to do with a new rifle... Feel free to check my feedback on ebay (handle- achildofthesky), 24 hour campfire, Marlin Owners, The High Road (THR), gunbroker, arguntrader. I am an individual and not a dealer or business and because of this, the gun is sold with out warranties of any type on my part and all sales are final. That said, if you have been looking for a new in box example of these exceptionally beautiful and VERY rare rifles, you will not be dissapointed with this one. Thanks for looking and good luck bidding.

I have a couple of other guns and some ammo I will be listing in the coming weeks to further fund unforeseen medical expenses. Thanks for looking and be safe.

title: For Trade:  Stoeger 2000 12 gauge
postcontent:
This is such a good shooting shotgun it is a shame that it just sits in my safe. Thought maybe I would try to pass it on to someone who would use it. Not in a big hurry to get rid of it and if I can't get a decent trade it can stay in the safe.

Stoeger 2000, semi-auto, inertia driven, 12 gauge. 2 3/4" or 3" shells. 28" vent rib barrel with fiber optic front sight. Has Limbsaver recoil pad installed. Comes with several choke tubes (takes Beretta choke tubes, so they are easy to find everywhere). I have the original box and paperwork. I have put thousands of rounds through this thing (mostly at Colorado Clays) and have only had three minor ejection issues in those thousands of rounds and those were ammunition related. I cleaned and lubed it after every 100 rounds or so. 

This is a great gun for sporting clays, trap, skeet, dove, pheasant, even duck and geese if you aren't one of those guys that "has to have a 3 1/2" gun".

Here is a link to the manufacturers website. http://www.stoegerindustries.com/firearms/stoeger_model_2000.php

Will entertain all trade offers but mostly interested in a smaller caliber bolt action rifle (22 Hornet, .223 Rem, 7mm-08, 243, etc.), a lever action .357, .44 mag, or .45 Colt, a Ruger Blackhawk in 41 or 44 mag with a 4 5/8" or 5 1/2" barrel, or maybe a second gen Glock 22 in nice shape, a Springfield XD in 40 cal, or a RIA 1911.

title: For Sale:  Enfield No.2 Mk.I* revolver "Tanker" .38 cal
postcontent:
This Enfield comes with a WWI dated leather holster. $375obo. All looks to work fine. Here is what I found online. Thank you to all that wrote and helped with this.


:Type: Double Action (Mark 1) or Double Action Only (Mark 1* and Mark 1**)
Chamber: .38/200 (.38S&W)
Weight unloaded: 765 g
Length: 260 mm
Barrel length: 127 mm
Capacity: 6 rounds



This revolver was developed at the Royal Small Arms Factory in Enfield in 1926 - 1927. The design is based on scaled down Webley Mark 6 "break-top" frame, with cylinder chambered for 6 .38/200 rounds. The hammer/trigger group was redesigned, with manual hammer safety lock added, and with separate cylinder lock. This revolver was adopted for British Military service in 1932 as Enfield revolver, .38 caliber, No.2 Mark 1. After 1938, almost all No.2 Mk1s were converted into No.2 Mark 1* configuration.

Enfield No.2 Mark 1* were developed in the late 1930s for British Tank Corps, and are distinguished from early Mark 1 by spurless, Double Action Only hammers, lighter mainsprings, and re-shaped grip side plates. The spurless DAO hammers were required by Tank Corps command to avoid snagging the hammers on tank internals.

Enfield No.2 Mark 1** appeared in the 1942 as a simplified, wartime design. These guns were similar to No.2 Mark 1*, but withouth the hammer stop. After the 1945, all those revolvers were recalled and converted into No.2 Mark 1* configuration.

title: For Sale/Trade:  *VERY RARE* 1911 Springfield 10mm "LINKLESS"
postcontent:
This is a very rare 1911. It is a LINKLESS 1911 in 10mm. Basically it means the recoil spring and barrel are set up more like a Glock (NO LINK PIN, ETC) and helps reduce felt recoil for the hotter round. This is how it was desinged from the facotry and NOT just some 45 a gunsmith modified.

It is in 95%+ condition with under 100rds total fired. There are 2 magazines (Springfield 8rd and McGar 8rd) as well as the original box. Gun was manuf 10/1990.

Asking $950 obo

Rob J

title: For Sale/Trade:  Beretta 96 Border marshall
postcontent:
This is a rare and cool find.

I have a beretta 96 Border marshall in .40 cal.  There are built and designed for the INS Border patrol back in 2000.
That was the only year they were produced.  Only 2000 were made.  I think only about 10 or 20 percent of that number was made into 9mm and the rest .40 cal.  

Anyways.  Its a rare find.  
It is basically the beretta elite design that was built for service work.  Has the re enforced Brigadier slide.  Has night sights that are not as bright as they use to be but they are removable front and rear sights.  Most berettas you can't replace the sights on them.  Has the Centurion Barrel.  Doesn't stick out like most Barrels.  Like a compact barrel on a full sized frame.

Does have some slight wear markings on the gun.
in corners buy barrel and some on the barrel.   one small part on the slide..   but its still a neat find for Beretta enthusiast!
Have box.  One Mag.  No paperwork
Not sure of round count.  
I shot it and its nice. 
Will throw in some Hornady critcal defense for right deal

Looking for sale or trade
interested in Glocks Sigs Beretta CZ Hi Power M&P 
All trades welcome
